talk.title: A Journey to the Discovery of Higgs Boson
talk.abstract: The Higgs boson was predicted in 1964 to provide masses of the carrier of electro-weak interactions, but did not predict any specific mass of Higgs boson and had a range from zero to 1 TeV. In nineties, experiments at Large Electron Position (LEP) collider at CERN, Geneva looked for the signature of Higgs bosons and gradually ruled out Higgs with lower mass (>114.4 GeV). In parallel experimentals on proton-proton collision at Tevatron, Fermi National Accelerator Laboratory (FNAL), USA also ended up with the null results. The Large Hadron Collider (LHC) at Geneva was constructed mainly to look for this boson and within few years of the operations, experiments at LHC had discovered Higgs boson in 2012. In this talk I will try to give a summary of various steps of this journey
